dt: {bc}a usually spicy sandwich in Vietnamese cuisine consisting of a split baguette filled typically with meat (such as pork or chicken) and pickled vegetables (such as carrot and daikon) and garnished with cilantro and often cucumbers

dt.t: Here we have the original {wi}banh mi{/wi}—a reliable favourite on a classic crusty baguette. Cold cut-style pork belly, chicken liver pâté (you can sub in avocado if that's more your thing), and soy-based Vietnamese sausage are finished with pickled carrots and daikon … , cucumbers, cilantro, aïoli and special sauce.
In Queen Anne, the Vietnamese coffee shop Queen Càphê serves {wi}banh mis{/wi} and spring rolls.

et: borrowed from Vietnamese {it}bánh mì,{/it} literally, "bread, baguette," from {it}bánh{/it} "cake, pastry" + {it}mì{/it} "wheat"
shortdef: a usually spicy sandwich in Vietnamese cuisine consisting of a split baguette filled typically with meat (such as pork or chicken) and pickled vegetables (such as carrot and daikon) and garnished with cilantro and often cucumbers
